  1719. First, I'll say that I'm really not one to go out of my way to write a product review; in addition to being generally lazy, most things I've tried aren't even remotely effective enough for me to ever even have an inkling to write one. But I received sweat block in the mail on Friday of last week. I tried it for the first time that night. And the next day, when I went out into the world, for the first time in my post-adolescent life, I did not sweat like I just ran a marathon.. My first test of the product was my usual weekend walk down Broadway (about 1.5 miles) carrying a large purse and wearing a medium-weight sweater. Usually, by about .5 miles in, I would be sweating visibly. But I made the entire walk to my destination AND the entire walk back to my dorm (3 miles) WITHOUT SWEATING AT ALL. This, needless to say, was monumental for me. For the first time ever, I returned home from an extended walk (not even a run) NOT sweaty and NOT needing to immediately strip down and hop in the shower.. I was dry. Wow. (Is this how normal people feel all the time? It's freaking awesome!) That night when I went to bed, I thought maybe this first day was just lucky and that tomorrow surely, when I do my zumba/cycling/jogging circuit, I'll return to being the sweat ogre woman. But when morning rolled around, I got dressed in my workout clothes, I walked a mile to my gym (usually makes me sweaty), I took 1 hour of zumba (drenched), and 40 minutes of jogging/stationary bike (more drenched--can wring sweat out of hair and clothes) AND HOLY MARY MOTHER OF GOD FOR THE FIRST TIME IN MY FREAKING LIFE I did not LOOK LIKE I HAD JUST STEPPED OUT OF THE SHOWER..<br /><br />...I don't know what this mysterious chemist did to make this product. But whoever he is, he is no chemist. He's a flipping alchemist.. I didn't think it could be done. Literally ONE WEEK AGO, I was resigned to living the REST OF MY LIFE covering up under layers and layers of clothes to hide my faulty body temperature regulation system from the world. I'm only 21, but I was planning on which \\"sweaters\\" and \\"jackets\\" to pack for my summer abroad in tropical weather. I never thought I would be able to wear a t-shirt without a jacket, a dress without a sweater, an anything without a COVER of any kind--all because my sweating was RUINING my life and outfit choices. I found sweat block because I'm graduating this month and was researching to see if they made any kind of dresses that don't show sweat--back when I thought working around the sucky problem was the only method of conciliation. But now that I've found sweat block... hell, I actually have hope.. A hope unlike any I've ever experienced before. I actually don't know how to react to it.. It's like I'm so ecstatic that I'm worried sick. I worry everyday because I fear this phenomenon might be short-lived and that I may have to return to living my life prisoner to layers and scarves.. I'm still getting used to lifting my arms more than 30 degrees away from my sides in public.. This may sound small and inconsequential, but for a nervous life-long sweater, this is a bigggg step.. I can't believe this product actually worked. Because I've tried everything.. Like EVERYTHING else. And they didn't do diddly squat. So, trust me when I say.. Sweat Block changes lives. If you're on the fence about this stuff, don't indulge your skepticism. It's only holding you back from wearing gray t-shirts in public. (yes, you can be that someone too!).<br /><br />In conclusion, Sweat Block, listen well: if you ever shut down (for whatever reason, so help us god), PLEASE WARN US IN ADVANCED. My life is changing because I'm not hiding in the corner of the gym because I'm drenched in sweat after doing as little as 10 minutes of moderate cardio.. I'm not the only girl at the beach wearing a parka.. I'm going to wear a gorgeous dress to my graduation and FEEL CONFIDENT that people are looking at ME and not my ginormous inexplicable pit stains. I don't know how I could repay you for what you've given me. (How do you put a price on self-esteem?) In closing, I'm telling everyone I know (who has sweating problems) about Sweat Block. I wish to the universe that someone had told me about it earlier, but now that I have it, I'm not wasting another moment being the layer-lady. I have arms that want to see sunlight, gosh darnit! And it's about time :). A thousand times, thank you!

  1830. This is a fantastic product if you suffer from excessive underarm/body sweat! Unfortunately of all my father's genes, he passed on to me his &#34;sweaty&#34; gene. When first using the product it might take two consecutive applications, I'm sure every person's chemistry is different.<br /><br />A couple of tips, if you have long or thick underarm hair, trim it to no more that 1/4-1/2&#34;. Excessive hair can prevent the product from being absorbed by the skin. The shorter the hair, the better. Also, if you trim the same night as the application, be very very careful not to cut yourself as the product WILL burn and sting for a few minutes, it's not too bad, much like alcohol. Make sure you heed the directions and only apply at night, as one's sweat glands are less active at night and the product can absorb and be effective. Using it during the day has little to no effect.<br /><br />You will still need deodorant. This product is a very strong anti-antiperspirant and not a deodorant.<br /><br />I average about 10 days per application, but the product says 7, so give it a try and see what you think, it has absolutely restored my confidence and eliminated those disgusting pit-stains in my shirts!<br /><br />It is also great for other sweaty parts (hands, back, etc...), just don't get too adventurous.

I would sweat profusely in social situations, during slight physical exertion, eating spicy foods and sometimes for no reason at all. Very embarrassing and a pain in the butt.<br /><br />I happened to see a mention of \\"SweatBlock\\" on a Hyperhidrosis forum. It sounded too good to be true. Even though there are many good reviews here I was highly skeptical. But for $20, I thought I'd give it a shot.<br /><br />Even though the instructions don't specifically say it can be used on the face, that's what I did. I applied some before bedtime fully expecting nothing to happen. It tingled for a few minutes and that was it. I forgot about it. Then a couple days later I went to my favorite Korean restaurant. I always have to constantly wipe my face with napkins when eating spicy foods. I thought I could feel some sweat, touched my forehead and it was completely dry! Hot damn, this stuff actually works!!! Not only that, somehow I sweat less in other areas too. It's like once some sweat glands get started, they trigger all their neighbors to go crazy too. Usually if I'm sweating on my face, my scalp and neck are also sweaty, but not with SweatBlock. I don't know how this works, but it does.<br /><br />I've been using SweatBlock for nine months now. I don't even think about Hyperhydrosis anymore. They say it lasts up to a week, but I've found I can go up to two weeks without reapplying.<br /><br />I feel like a new person. I can sit in a business meeting with confidence that I won't suddenly turn into a sweat hog. What a life changer. The inventor of SweatBlock deserves a Nobel prize.

Once you use it again, the sweating stops. Also, if you are female, don't use it right after you shave your arm pits, because it will burn. I advise, shaving the day before or after. Finally, always wear your daily deodorant in addition to Sweat Block.

I do recommend these products though, they are best thing I've tried and u get a lot of them for the money.

So bad that I tried to wipe it off after half an hour. That helped for a couple minutes. Then the stinging progressed to burning. The burning continued through the night, then through the day. And then through the night again. I'm sort of at the point where I'm just praying that it gets better before the end of the week, since I have a big trip that I have to go on and I would rather not have to keep thinking about how much my armpits are burning.<br />I will say that for as much as it burns, it does seem like it helped my sweating a good amount. I'd say that it decreased it by 50%-ish.<br />Anything that helped at all I would give 5 stars at this point, but I gave it 3 because of the PAIN.

I find that the skin around my armpit area is a bit sensitive and gets irritated with weekly use, so I've dialed back my usage to about every 10 days, and it works like a charm. The time to begin working was the same, but the total reduction in sweating seemed slightly greater with the gel. That's perfect for underarms (and the product is sold for underarm use) but it's difficult to get adequate coverage on the scalp. I think that's why I haven't had complete success with it. If it were sold in, say, a roll-on, it would work better on other areas of the body.

So I purchased the sweat blocker, applied it at night, and the next day at work I visually noted NO underarm sweating, where did it go?????? So I thought. maybe I just did not have a stressful enough day..... yeah right!!!!!!! So I applied it a second nite and the next day after work, no under arm sweat stains, and it was a long and tough day. So, having the brillant mind that I have, I thought, hey, maybe the sweat blocker really works! But the sweat has to be released somewhere, the body HAS to sweat to stay cool, so where do I sweat, are you asking? Well, the back of my neck and back lower part of my head. But no worries there, my hair is short and I just make a trip to the restroom and swipe the sweatly area with cool damp towel, fluff up the hair on the back of my head, and off I go.   2387. I've bought Sweat Block 2x through Amazon. The product works well for a sweater like me = I excessively sweat when anxious, nervous and in various social settings. It feels good to not have that wet feelings under my arms at times I really shouldn't. When I work out, I do notice some underarm sweating, but this is the time when it's 'OK' for me. And it 'dries up' under my arms faster when using this product.<br />I would, and have, recommended Sweat Block to fellow excessive sweaters. The only problem(thus the 4 stars) is the price charged by Amazon. You can buy 5 weeks worth for between $6 - $7 at Walmart. The last time I bought it on Amazon it was approx. $20 for 8 weeks worth, so you can see it's less expensive at Walmart.<br />Very good product, but you can find it less expensive. Worth buying but shop around for the best price.
